TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
59
SEint Eu&slong;tas þe noble kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; of heþene londelawe was
Ake are he ic&combtildevert;&slong;tned icristned were &punctelev; men cleopeden him placidas Placidas
he wa&slong; with Traian þe Aumperour &punctelev; hext of alle is kniȝhte
Mai&slong;ter he wa&slong; of al is o&slong;t &punctelev; at eche bataile to fiȝhte
he wilnede to wite gode&slong; Godes lawe &punctelev; and of c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom
Ake no man þarof him ne teiȝhte &punctelev; ne ȝeme þareto ne nam
¶his heo&rrot;te him ȝaf þat is lawe nas nouȝt &punctelev; and þarefo&rrot;e alme&slong;dede
Ofte he dude fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; þat he him &slong;cholde þe bet rede
A wif he hadde and twei &slong;ones &punctelev; þat swiþe ȝoungue were
heo wilnede ȝeo&rrot;ne þat &slong;um man &punctelev; of god God hire wolde lere
þis heiȝe kniȝhtes wenden a da&ydot; &punctelev; on honteth mani on
with heo&rrot;e cheuente&ydot;n placidas Placidas
&punctelev; to cachche hert and bocke and don
¶Among oþur game hu&ydot; founden ane heo&rrot;t &punctelev; &slong;wiþe fair be&slong;t withalle
placidas Placidas him &slong;iwede anon &punctelev; ȝif he miȝhte maken him falle
Fram is felawe&slong; he wende al one &punctelev; þis be&slong;t o&rrot;n with gret pas
And he &slong;iwede him fer in vncouþe &slong;tude &punctelev; þat al weri he was
þo hu&ydot; comen opon a fair hul &punctelev; þis be&slong;t with&slong;tod atþe la&slong;te
þis kniȝht ne do&rrot;&slong;te ner him wiende &punctelev; ake biheold him &slong;tikele and fa&slong;te
Bitwene is ho&rrot;ne&slong; he i&slong;aiȝh &punctelev; ane creiz &slong;chine b&rrot;iȝhte
with gret leome a&slong;e it were of &slong;onne &punctelev; þat vnneþe biholde he it miȝhte
¶Placidas &slong;eide þe heo&rrot;t &punctelev; ȝw&ydot; woltþou weo&rrot;ri with me
Icham god God þat þou ne knowe&slong;t nouȝt &punctelev; ichulle &slong;chewi me to þe
þine alme&slong;&slong;ededes þat þou ha&slong;t ido &punctelev; amountede ⁁⁁bi⁁⁁fore⁁⁁ me⁁⁁ bifore me me bifo&rrot;e
þat þou ne can&slong;t nouȝt ichulle þe teche &punctelev; þat þi soule ne beo fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
þov were aboute to cachche me &punctelev; ichulle þe cahche al&slong;o
Louerd &slong;eide placidas Placidas &punctelev; seiȝe me ȝwat i &slong;chal do
¶Bote go &slong;eide o&rrot;e louerd þo &punctelev; hom to þine wiue
And nim hire and evwere twei &slong;ones &punctelev; and lat eou c&combtildevert;&slong;tni cristni bliue
þus time tomo&rrot;uwe cu&combtilde; cum aȝein &punctelev; and ich þe wolle wis&slong;e
hou þou &slong;chalt leden here þi lijf &punctelev; to of&slong;erui heouene bli&slong;&slong;e
þo nu&slong;te he ȝware þe heo&rrot;t bicam &punctelev; þis kniȝht in grete þouȝte
wende hom and þonkede god God &punctelev; þat &slong;wuch tiþingue him b&rrot;ouȝhte
his wiue he tolde it p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; &slong;ire merci heo &slong;eide
Toniȝht o&rrot;e louerd cam al&slong;o to me &punctelev; and riȝht so he gan me rede
¶Hu&ydot; nomen heo&rrot;e twe&ydot; &slong;ones with heom &punctelev; and to a bi&slong;chop hu&ydot; wende
And lieten heom c&combtildevert;&slong;tni cristni alle foure &punctelev; heo&rrot;e lif fo&rrot;to amende
þis kn&ydot;⁁ȝth liet is name tu&ydot;rne &punctelev; and liet him cleopie Eu&slong;tas
With oþure kniȝhte&slong; he wende eft an hontez &punctelev; þudere a&slong;e he er was
þis holie be&slong;t he &slong;aiȝh þo eftsone &punctelev; aftur he wende al&slong;o
Fo&rrot;to he cam into a p&rrot;iue &slong;tude &punctelev; a&slong;e he hadde er ido
· 59 ·
þo criede he and fel adoun akneo &punctelev; louerd he &slong;eide þin o&rrot;e
Tel me hou i &slong;chal mi lif lede &punctelev; to &slong;aui me þo&rrot;uȝh þi lo&rrot;e
Ore
louerd &slong;pac þo in þe heo&rrot;te&slong; mouþe &punctelev; loke þat þou do after me
Fo&rrot; þov ha&slong;t þene deuel ouercome &punctelev; he armeth him aȝen þe
þolie þou &slong;chalt wo and &slong;o&rrot; &punctelev; a&slong;e Men men &slong;chulle in bata&ydot;lle
Ȝif þou wolt þolie and aȝein him fiȝhte of is wille he &slong;chal faille
he &slong;chal þe a&slong;e he dude Iob &punctelev; mid alle wo þe fonde
Seie me ȝif þou it þolie wolt &punctelev; and fa&slong;te aȝein him &slong;tonde
¶Louerd &slong;eide þis guode kniȝht &punctelev; ȝif me &slong;tudefa&slong;thede
þat ich mouwe is fondingue þole &punctelev; a&slong;e þou me wolt wi&slong;&slong;e and rede
Ope þi&slong;ulue it is ȝif þou wolt beo &punctelev; &slong;tudefa&slong;t o&rrot;e louerd &slong;eide
Ake ȝif þou wolt &slong;o ichulle in þi care &punctelev; boþe witie þe and lede
Mid þu&slong;&slong;e wo&rrot;de o&rrot;e louerd wende &punctelev; he nu&slong;te ȝware he bicam
þi&slong; kniȝht in grete þouȝhte of heo&rrot;te &punctelev; þene we&ydot; hamward nam
his wiue he tolde al hou it was &punctelev; and bad hire &slong;tudefa&slong;t be
To is louerde&slong; court þe aum&pbardes;eroure&slong; aumperoures &punctelev; nolde he no&combtilde;mo&rrot;e nonmore teo
¶þo comen þeoues and robbeden him &punctelev; of al þat euere he hadde
his Orf orf deide al&slong;o to grounde &punctelev; nouȝht o be&slong;t aliue he nadde
his hinene deiden euerechone &punctelev; þare bilefde non aliue
Bote he and
is tweie ȝongue &slong;ones &punctelev; and is leoue wiue
þo ne bilefde heom non mo&rrot;e guod &punctelev; þane heom hieng aboute
hu&ydot; þonkeden god God of alle is &slong;ondene &punctelev; ȝu&ydot;t nadden hu&ydot; none doute
Fo&rrot; schame þat hu&ydot; beggare&slong; weren &punctelev; heo&rrot;e hous hu&ydot; liete &slong;tonde
And bi niȝhte &slong;telen awei &punctelev; toward an oþur londe
¶Eu&slong;tas alone and is wijf &punctelev; and is &slong;ones tweiȝe
So ȝungue weren þis child&rrot;en two &punctelev; þat he bar heom ofte bi weiȝe
Gret deol made þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour Aumperour &punctelev; þo he mi&slong;te Sire Eu&slong;tas
And liet him &slong;eche alaboute &punctelev; ake men nu&slong;ten ȝware he wa&slong;
Toward Eg&ydot;pte hu&ydot; pa&slong;&slong;eden þe se &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; mo&slong;ten &slong;o don nede
Þo hu&ydot; þe se ipa&slong;&slong;ede hadden &punctelev; þe &slong;chipman axede is mede
hu&ydot; &slong;eiden þat hu&ydot; noþing nadden &punctelev; ake þat hu&ydot; beggare&slong; were
Þe &slong;chipman biheold þat guode wif &punctelev; and þouȝte him of faire chere
¶he &slong;eide ichulle fo&rrot; mi mede &punctelev; þi&slong; wumman with me atholde
Þe kniȝht weop and c&combtildevert;ede criede ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; ake hit ne mihȝte noþing holde
Þis &slong;chipman nam[MS. nan] him and is &slong;one&slong; &punctelev; and out of þe &slong;chipe heom þ&rrot;a&slong;te
And liet heom wienden ȝwodere hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; and heold[MS. beold] þis womman fa&slong;te
Þe kn&ydot;ȝht biheold afterward &punctelev; ake þo it nonoþur na&slong;
So&rrot;e he weop and wrond wrong is honden &punctelev; longue i&slong;wowe he was
Leue &slong;one&slong; he &slong;eide ȝwat &slong;chulle ȝe nou? &punctelev; ȝoungue ȝe beoth helples
In vncouþe londe ho &slong;chal ou wite &punctelev; nouþe ȝe beoth moderle&slong;
¶Misulf ich couþe mine mete bi&slong;w&ydot;nke &punctelev; ake inot ȝwat ȝe &slong;chulle do
A feble no&rrot;ice ich am alas &punctelev; i nas neuere iteiȝht þerto
Wel &slong;ofte he ladde is &slong;one&slong; fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and wel ofte he heom bar
To a deop watur he cam &punctelev; and no &slong;chip ne fond he þar
he bar is o &slong;one ouer þat watur &punctelev; and þare adoun him &slong;ette
This folio has been mostly torn out, so Horstmann takes lines 86-130 from London, British Library, Cotton Julius D ix. I have restored surviving portions of lines 86-93. The rest is Horstmann's text and represents only a critical view.
þeo ȝ&ydot;le he wente ouer aȝen &punctelev; his oþer sone to fette
þo he was amidde þe water as he was &punctelev; a wolf þer com vrne
And nam þat child & ber hit ford &punctelev; touard þe wode ȝerne
A leon cam in þe oþer half &punctelev; & þis oþer child he nom
And bbere hit ford touard þe wode &punctelev; ar þe faþer to him com
¶þis kniȝt stod amidde þe water &punctelev; no wonder þe him wo were
ȝwan he sei þat þis wilde bestes &punctelev; his sones awei bere
he wep & his hondes wrong &punctelev; & tar him be þe here
himsulf he wolde habbe adreint &punctelev; ȝif þat oþing nere
he þoȝte on þat our lord sede &punctelev; þat he scholde þolie sore
he þolede him þoȝte sorue ynou &punctelev; noman ne miȝte more
lord he sede whiþer schal ich nou &punctelev; & wente bi an vncouþe weie
kniȝtes ich was ywoneþ to haue &punctelev; wit me of gret nobleie
¶ Ich les hom suþþe & al my good &punctelev; þat ich scholde bi leþe mi lif
Mene bileueþe oþer solas non &punctelev; bote my sones & my wif
þo mi wif me was bynome &punctelev; nas me wo ynou
ȝif ich dorste sigge ich was &punctelev; ibroȝt in more wo wit wou
Me nas bileueþ bote mi sones &punctelev; þat al myn herten were
þo sei ich whare wilde bestes &punctelev; awei to wode hom bere
& icham a wrecche & frendles &punctelev; bileueþ nou alone
al nakeþ & bar of alle gode &punctelev; as ich sprong out of þe stone
¶ wel ichot þat iob hadde &punctelev; ynou of care & sore
a lone wrecche as icham &punctelev; me þincþ ichaue more
for he hadde frend & wif also &punctelev; him fo&rrot;to bimene
me nis bileueþ wif ne frend &punctelev; to solaci me ene
a dunghupel warup he him reste &punctelev; him was also bileueþ
of al my god God so moche y naue &punctelev; þat ich mow rest op my hed
of al men þat euer were &punctelev; me þinch icham mest wrecche
ac whan god God wol so þat ich schal &punctelev; of noþing Ine recche
þo he hadde al ymad his mone &punctelev; þat reuþe hit was ynou
In sorue & care spitosliche &punctelev; touard toune he d&rrot;ou
¶ þer he ȝede & beþ his mete &punctelev; þat al folc reuþe hadde
þat so fair man & stalworde &punctelev; in meseise his lif ladde
haiward hi made him of þe toun &punctelev; hor corn forto wite
þat he miȝte in treunesse &punctelev; his liflode beȝite
his lordinges he paide wel &punctelev; & al oþere also
fo&rrot; hoso haþ wit him godes Godes grace &punctelev; he ne schal neuer misdo
fo he ne couþe noȝt his mester &punctelev; gret sorue he hadde ynou
his wo he nom in pacience &punctelev; to eche godnesse he drou
heyward he was fiftene ȝer &punctelev; in gret sorue & care
ne com noman nei him þat him kneu &punctelev; his frend him were wel bare
¶ ac hit bifel þat þe emperour &punctelev; þat his lod er was
yworreþ was of a noþer king &punctelev; þorou a luþer cas
sone him misseþe þis gode kniȝt &punctelev; & ofte he sede alas
Almost all of 167(b) verso has been torn off. Line 130 appears to end with the word "&slong;wiþe", and line 131 with "[se]thþe (?) wide". The Laud Misc. 108 text thus differed somewhat from the text as found in London, British Library, Cotton Julius D ix.
to many lond he sente aboute &punctelev; to seche seint eustas
tuei kniȝtes þat his felaues were &punctelev; þat soȝte him suiþe wide
In his baille hi mette him &punctelev; as hi come þerford ride
seint eustas ikneu hom wel &punctelev; & hi him noȝt witalle
fo&rrot; hoso is in meseise & in sor &punctelev; his heu wole sone falle
¶ knowest hi sede eni man &punctelev; þat hatte placidas Placidas
he sede nai & sede soþ &punctelev; for he het eustas
þo gonne þis kniȝtes sike sore &punctelev; & hit was nei eue
þis haiward hom baþ suiþe faire &punctelev; al niȝt wit him bileue
þo hi come hom to his In &punctelev; he made hom faire chere
& cortesliche serueþe hom &punctelev; quinte man as he were
ac euer whan he from hom turneþe &punctelev; þe teres ourne of his eie
ac fair semblant he made ynou &punctelev; euer whan hi him seie
¶ þis kniȝtes þoȝte wonþer gret &punctelev; þat a such heiward
of so quinte seruise was &punctelev; as he were eny stuard
þe lengor þat hi him bihulde &punctelev; þe bet hom þoȝte [hi] him kneue
for whan man is fol of mete & drinke &punctelev; hit so teleþ in his hwe
þis man sede þe on to þe oþer &punctelev; ilich is placidas Placidas
loke we where he haue þe wounde &punctelev; þat on his hed was
þat he hente in þe bataile &punctelev; for ȝif he haþ þilke wounde
In þilke stude siker we beþ &punctelev; þat we him haueþ ifounde
þo hi founde þis soþe tokne &punctelev; in gret ioie hi were ibroȝt
hi sede þu art placidas Placidas &punctelev; þat we longe haueþ isoȝt
¶ þe emperour sente after þe &punctelev; to him þu schalt come
for his fon haueþ moche of his lond &punctelev; for þe faute defaute of þe ynome
sein eustas made gret daunger &punctelev; & naþeles ate nende
to þe emperour of rome his lord &punctelev; wit hom he gan wende
glad tiþing com to þe emperour &punctelev; þo he him isay
he let him greidi in fair atir &punctelev; as noble kniȝt & hei
he let ȝarki his ost also &punctelev; mony kniȝt & sueyn
& made eustas as he was er &punctelev; of hom alle cheuenteyn
¶ hi wente & worreþe op hor fon &punctelev; to grounde fer & ner
hi þat er al maistres were &punctelev; nadde do no poer
more prouesse ne miȝte be &punctelev; þan was of þis kniȝte
for he was of bodi strong &punctelev; & moche couþe of fiȝte
& he hadde wit him godes Godes grace &punctelev; be dai & by nyȝte
þerfore non heden man &punctelev; aȝen him stonde ne miȝte
þo þe king hor fo vnþerȝet &punctelev; þat his poer noding nas
& þat he ne miȝte worre holde &punctelev; aȝen sein eustas
¶ he flei hom into his owe lond &punctelev; vnneþe wit þe liue
seint eustas wit his gode route &punctelev; after sueþe bliue
of his men he let ek mony nyme &punctelev; & slou ek of hom riue
he let sle al oþer nyme &punctelev; oþer out of londe hom driue
ȝut he suor he wolde awreke be &punctelev; of þe gret schonde
þat hi hadde his lord yworreþ &punctelev; in his owe londe
¶ gret maister he wex anon &punctelev; what whare was þo his horn
he ne ȝede noȝt in þe feld afote &punctelev; to wite man mannes corn
a maister heiward he was on &punctelev; wit such men to fiȝte
to porswy into his owe lond &punctelev; a king of so gret miȝte
he let ordeine wel his ost &punctelev; & parti hit aþre
· 49 · Eustas 168
Cheuente&ydot;ne&slong; he liet
chese tweie &punctelev; vnder him to beo
¶Þare weren ȝoungue tweie &punctelev; faire manc men men withalleIt is possible that the slightly faded "c" in "manc" was originally intended as an "e" and formed part of an attempted scribal correction.
with red heued ȝeolu and crips &punctelev; fair cas þare gan bifalle
Fo&rrot; þere nere none into al þe O&slong;t ost &punctelev; þat &slong;o &slong;talewo&rrot;þ⁁e men were
Ne of &slong;o gret p&rrot;ouwe&slong;&slong;e in þe bataile &punctelev; ne þat &slong;o wel armes bere
Þarefo&rrot;e Ev&slong;tas vnder him &punctelev; cheuente&ydot;ne&slong; heom made þere
E&ydot;þer is owene >compa&ydot;e compaynie &punctelev; &slong;wiþe wel to lede and lere
hu&ydot; &slong;iweden heo&rrot;e fo into is lond &punctelev; noþing ad&rrot;adde hu&ydot; nere
And þo hu&ydot; þe se ipa&slong;&slong;ed hadden &punctelev; heo&rrot; banere&slong; hu&ydot; lieten[MS. leieten] arere
¶Into al þat lond hu&ydot; wenten aboute &punctelev; and nomen alle þat hu&ydot; founden
heo&rrot;e fon hu&ydot; slowen þat heo&rrot;e pouwer &punctelev; wa&slong; &slong;one ib&rrot;ouȝt to grounde
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; nomen &slong;ome and ladden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; with heom fa&slong;te ibounde
Some hu&ydot; ra&ydot;meden fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e lif &punctelev; of manie harde pounde&slong;
Are hu&ydot; heom hadden &slong;o ouercome &punctelev; hu&ydot; ȝeuen manie wounde&slong;
Gultle&slong;e men þat weren of pais &punctelev; hu&ydot; lieten beo hole and &slong;ounde
hu&ydot; come and nomen a gret cite &punctelev; and þareinne hu&ydot; aliȝhte
A&slong;e louerde&slong; hu&ydot; re&slong;ten þere &punctelev; &slong;o fareth þat habbeth miȝhte
¶Þis two cheuente&ydot;ne&slong; þat weren &punctelev; onder &slong;ire Eu&slong;tas
hu&ydot; ca&slong;ten of heo&rrot;e helme&slong; heom fo&rrot;to auente &punctelev; heo&rrot;e bodi ful weri was
Vnder a chaumb&rrot;e hu&ydot; re&slong;ten heom &punctelev; in a wel fair herber
hu&ydot; tolden of heo&rrot;e grete p&rrot;ouwe&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; duden feo&rrot; and ner
Wonderliche þat on &slong;eide &punctelev; ich am fo&rrot;th igon
Mi fader was kn&ydot;ȝht of gret pouwer &punctelev; ni&slong; nouȝh were nouþe &slong;chuch on
¶he and mi moder &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; lieten heom c&combtildevert;&stlong;tni cristni be&ydot;e
And me and mi ȝoungue b&rrot;oþur[MS. b&rrot;oþus] &punctelev; þat weren his &slong;one&slong; be&ydot;ȝetwe&ydot;e
A niȝht he nam is wif and us &punctelev; þat his &slong;one&slong; were
And ladde us into anoþur lond &punctelev; þare we neu&combtildevert;er neuerer nere
Þo we þe se ipa&slong;&slong;ede hadden &punctelev; þe Mariner mariner fo&rrot; is hu&ydot;re
Drof us out of is &slong;chip·and o&rrot;e moder ladde awe&ydot; &punctelev; þat us was leof and du&ydot;re
¶Ore fader nam us and ladde us fo&rrot;th &punctelev; &slong;wiþe gret deol he made
To a water we comen þat was &slong;o deop &punctelev; þat we ne miȝhten nouȝht wade
Mi fader bar ouer mine ȝounguere b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; and in þat oþur half him &slong;ette
And cam a wolf and bar him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le he
me wolde fette
And are he miȝhte to me come &punctelev; a leon þare cam eo&rrot;ne
And kipte me and bar me fo&rrot;th &punctelev; toward þe wode wel ȝeo&rrot;ne
¶Schepherde&slong; o&rrot;nen him aȝein &punctelev; with ho&rrot;ne&slong; and with hounde
And crieden and &slong;choten toward him &punctelev; þat he me liet falle to grounde
hu&ydot; nomen and ladden me to heo&rrot;e hous &punctelev; and lieten me fo&rrot;th b&rrot;ingue
Of fader ne of moder ne can ich &punctelev; telle eov no t&ydot;þingue
¶Louerd c&combtildevert;&slong;t Crist &slong;eide þat oþur &punctelev; ihered beo þi miȝhte
Þat ich mo&slong;te of mine leoue b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; habbe one &slong;iȝhte
Certe&slong; he &slong;eide ich am þi b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; þat þe wolf awei bar
Ake Akermen akermen weren in þe feld &punctelev; þat weren of him iwar
with &slong;taue&slong; and with &slong;tone&slong; al&slong;o &punctelev; aȝen him hu&ydot; o&rrot;nen bliue
And maden him legge me adoun &punctelev; so þat ich cam to liue
59
louerd muche was þe Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat bitwene heom was þere
Me&slong;t hu&ydot; bimenden fader and moder &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; nu&slong;ten ȝware hu&ydot; were
¶Heo&rrot;e Moder moder &slong;at and heo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; In ane chaumb&rrot;e þarebiside
welle louerd þat he heo was glad &punctelev; þat heo miȝhte þane da&ydot; abide
So&rrot;i heo was þat heo ne miȝhte out &punctelev; with hire &slong;one&slong; to speke
Ake heo wa&slong; biloke a&slong;e a p&rrot;i&slong;on &punctelev; ne heo ne miȝhte þat hous b&rrot;eke
Fo&rrot; heo and manie oþer &punctelev; in o&slong;tage weren itake
Bifo&rrot;e þe p&rrot;ince heo was &slong;ethþe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; hire fin fo&rrot;to make
Þo i&slong;aiȝ heo ȝware hire louerd was &punctelev; adoun heo feol to grounde
Ihered beo þou ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
c&combtildevert;&slong;t Crist heo &slong;eide &punctelev; mine louerd ich habbe ifounde
¶Þis guode kniȝht [gan][om.] fo&rrot; io&ydot;e to wepe &punctelev; he clupte hire and cu&slong;te
Mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e ioye þane
was heom bitwene &punctelev; no man neuerer nu&slong;te
Sire merci heo &slong;eide &punctelev; "ne haue þou no misþouȝt
Fo&rrot; god God it wot ich am clene &punctelev; and iwemmed nouȝt
Fo&rrot; al&slong;o &slong;one a&slong; þe luþere man &punctelev; me hadde fram þe ib&rrot;ouȝt
he vuelde and deide sone &punctelev; bi god God þat ich habbe isouȝt
Þo was þis guode kniȝht glado&rrot;e &punctelev; bi muche þane he ⁁⁁ er⁁⁁ was⁁⁁ er was
Dame he &slong;eide of o&rrot;e leoue &slong;one&slong; &punctelev; quite we beoth alas
Fo&rrot; a leon bar þat on awei &punctelev; and a wolf þat oþur al&slong;o
Wel ich wot þat hu&ydot; tod&rrot;awe beoth &punctelev; i not ȝwat we &slong;chullen do
¶Sire &slong;eide þis guode wif &punctelev; "make gret Io&ydot;e ioye withalle
Among alle þe men þat euere weren &punctelev; faire&slong;t us is bifalle
Fo&rrot; a&slong;e ich in a chaumb&rrot;e &slong;at &punctelev; kniȝhtes ich heo&rrot;de tweiȝe
Tellen of us &slong;o þat ich wot &punctelev; þat it weren ovre &slong;one&slong; beiȝe
Lat of&slong;echen ȝwuche hu&ydot; beoth &punctelev; fo⁁&rrot; &slong;oþe hu&ydot; beoth of þine
Beo glad and in alle Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; fo&rrot; we habbez ouercome o&rrot;e pine
¶Þis kniȝht fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e ioye liet &slong;ende aboute &punctelev; þe me&slong;&slong;agers neren nouȝt bih&ydot;nde
he liet &slong;eche and crien oueral &punctelev; ȝif men miȝhten anie &slong;wuche ifinde
he fond þat is &slong;one&slong; weren &punctelev; onder him cheuente&ydot;&slong; cheuenteyns
Þat he him&slong;ulf made fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e p&rrot;ouwe&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; of þe o&slong;te&slong; souereins
Glade hu&ydot; hadde er ibeo &punctelev; ake so glade neuere hu&ydot; nere
Þo fader and moder and þe sones &punctelev; togadere icome were
Þat þe fader and þe &slong;ones &punctelev; þe mai&slong;trie awei bere
And mai&slong;tres weren of al þat folk &punctelev; to o&rrot;deinen heom and to lere
¶Louerd muche is þi miȝhte &punctelev; and þat þou cudde&slong;t þere
Fo&rrot; þat þou i&slong;aued habbe wolt &punctelev; noþing ne &slong;chal furpere
¶Þo þis guode kniȝht and is &slong;one&slong; &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e o&slong;t atþen ende
Þe Mai&slong;t&combtildevert;e maistrie hadden of alle heo&rrot;e fon &punctelev; hamward hu&ydot; guonne wiende
with gret Io&ydot;e ioye and noble&ydot;e &punctelev; of no man heom ne d&rrot;adde
Alle þe hexte men of þe londe &punctelev; a&slong;e p&rrot;i&slong;ones with heom hu&ydot; ladde
Muche p&rrot;is þare was of heom &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; wenden toward rome Rome
Ake deolfole tiþingue&slong; hu&ydot; founden þere &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; þudere come
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; founden ho&rrot;e louerd ded &punctelev; þene Aumperour traIan Traian
And an oþer hu&ydot; founden imad after him &punctelev; þat hiet Ad&rrot;ian
Þat muche schame dude c&combtildevert;&slong;tine Cristine men &punctelev; ȝware anie weren inome
59 169
Gret Io&ydot;e ioye he made with þis kniȝhtes &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; weren þudere icome
Fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e p&rrot;ouwe&slong;&slong;e and fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e p&rrot;i&slong;ones &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; mid heom b&rrot;ouȝhte
hext p&rrot;ince of þat lond vnder him &punctelev; sire Eu&slong;tas makie he þouȝhte
Bote it were bi is red &punctelev; noþing don he nolde
And ȝwane he wende into anie &slong;tude &punctelev; euere mid him he &slong;cholde
¶A dai hu&ydot; comen bi heo&rrot;e temple &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e maumate&slong; inne were
Þe Aum&pbardes;erour Aumperour liȝhte adoun &punctelev; to don þare is p&rrot;eiere
Sire Eu&slong;tas nolde nouȝt þareinne come &punctelev; ake bilefde þerewithoute
Þe Aumperour in wrathþe axede anon &punctelev; ȝwareof he hadde doute
And ȝwi he ne aliȝhte a&slong;e riȝht were &punctelev; and to is godes aloute
Sire &slong;eide sire Eu&slong;tas it is fo&rrot; nouȝt &punctelev; þat þou art þareaboute
Ine rechche aliue ho it wite &punctelev; cri&slong;tine ich am iwis
Of swuch a p&rrot;ince a&slong;e þou art gret deol is &punctelev; þat &slong;o &slong;chal bileue amis
¶Ov &slong;eide þe Aum&pbardes;erour Aumperour &punctelev; ha&slong;t þou þus i&slong;eid
habbe ich þus iloued þe &punctelev; and þou me ha&slong;t bitreid
Ȝif þou loue&slong;t þin owene &slong;tat &punctelev; to&rrot;ne þi þouȝt ich rede
Oþur þou &slong;chalt &slong;egge þat þou ne dude&slong;t &punctelev; neuere &slong;o luþer dede
Certe&slong; &slong;ire fo&rrot; nouȝt it is &punctelev; þis guode kniȝht aȝein &slong;eide
holde ichulle þat ich habbe itake &punctelev; I ne bileue it fo&rrot; no d&rrot;ede
wodwroth wa&slong; þe Aum&pbardes;erour Aumperour &punctelev; he liet him binde fa&slong;te
And leden hom to is paleis &punctelev; and among leone&slong; him ca&slong;te
Þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden fo&rrot;&slong;wolewen euerech lime &punctelev; of þis guode kniȝhte
hu&ydot; alutten to him and lickeden him &punctelev; þare wa&slong; gode&slong; Godes miȝhte
¶þo is &slong;one&slong; and is wif &punctelev; herof heo&rrot;den telle
Þat þe Aum&pbardes;erour Aumperour heo&rrot;e louerd nome &punctelev; him fo&rrot;to aquelle
hu&ydot; comen eo&rrot;ne with gret e&ydot;r &punctelev; and axeden ȝware he were
And &slong;eiden hu&ydot; wolden fo&rrot; guode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; mid him deiȝe þere
he schok is heued and criede loude &punctelev; and ter him bi is here
he liet makie ane tonne of b&rrot;as &punctelev; fo&rrot;to berne heom þareinne
Wel wu&slong;ten þis guode kniȝhtes &punctelev; ȝwat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden þarewith iwinne
¶Þo was þe luþere Aum&pbardes;erour Aumperour &punctelev; wroþere þane he was bifo&rrot;e
Sire Eu&slong;tas &slong;at adoun akneo &punctelev; and &slong;eide nouþe louerd þin o&rrot;e
Graunte u&slong; to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene &punctelev; comen aftur þis &slong;o&rrot;e
And þat o&rrot;e þouȝt &slong;tudefa&slong;t beo &punctelev; and treowe eueremo&rrot;e
Graunte u&slong; þat alle guode men &punctelev; þat us habbuth in mu&ydot;nde
And of us bi&slong;echez help to þe &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; it moten finde
Þat hu&ydot; of peril beon ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; and of alle oþure vuele al&slong;o
Þat þou ȝif it is þi wille &punctelev; into þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene heom do
we foure þat muche of o&rrot;e lif &punctelev; iliued habbeth in wo
Graunte u&slong; one &slong;tude to o&rrot;e m&rabar;t&ydot;rdom mratyrdom &punctelev; and to o&rrot;e burijngue al&slong;o
Þat we in one &slong;tude fo&rrot;to dome&slong;da&ydot; &punctelev; togadere re&slong;ten mote
Þat þe &slong;ike of bodie and of soule &punctelev; at us habben bote
¶Þo cam þare a uo&ydot;z and &slong;eide &punctelev; Eu&slong;tas glad þou beo
Al þat þou ibede ha&slong;t &punctelev; god God hat⁁h igraunted þe
Þis to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong; nomen þis guode kniȝht &punctelev; and is &slong;one&slong; and is wif
60
And duden heom in ane tonne of b&rrot;a&slong; &punctelev; to leten þare heo&rrot;e lijf
Gret fu&ydot;r hu&ydot; þareaboute maden &punctelev; bineoþe and aboue
And þare hu&ydot; þoleden mart&ydot;rdom &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; loue
¶Þo þis fu&ydot;r hadde longue ibarnd &punctelev; aboute þe b&rrot;a&slong;ene tonne
And þat b&rrot;as wa&slong; muche imolte &punctelev; and togadere ironne
hu&ydot; eoden ner and þi&slong; holie men &punctelev; wel faire liggen hu&ydot; founde
So ȝwijht &slong;chininde &slong;o eni milk &punctelev; þe bodie&slong; hole and &slong;ounde
And þe &slong;oulene o&rrot;e louerd bitaiȝt &punctelev; fo&rrot; þare na&slong; of cloþe ne of here
Ne of no &slong;tude of alle heo&rrot;e bodies &punctelev; þat of þe fu&ydot;re iweommede were
¶Cri&slong;tine men awa&ydot;teden heo&rrot;e point &punctelev; and &slong;telen þareto bi niȝhte
And þeo&slong; holie bodie&slong; ladden awe&ydot; &punctelev; and longue þareto hu&ydot; tiȝhte
And bureden heom faire in one &slong;tude &punctelev; to ȝwuche hu&ydot; weren ib&rrot;ouȝt
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd wolde þat it were &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; hadden him ero&rrot;e bi&slong;ouȝt
An hond&rrot;ed ȝer ipa&slong;&slong;ede weren &punctelev; and twenti al&slong;o
Aftur o&rrot;e louerde&slong; bu&ydot;rt&ydot;me &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; weren to deþe ido
Þu&slong; Seint Eu&slong;tas mid is wif &punctelev; and mid is &slong;one&slong; cam
To þe heiȝe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;trong mart&ydot;rdom
